channel.title: Urgent Cache request - It requires your attention!
channel.description:
If you remember playing on an old hard drive that RuneScape was played on, you need to load that hard drive up. Once you do, follow these instructions:
[B]How to find the old cache(s)[/B] 1. Go to Start. 2. Click on My Computer 3. Click on to the "C:" Drive. 4. Click the "WINDOWS" folder. 5. You should see a folder that is either named ".jagex_cache_32" or ".file_store_32". 6. Archive it (.ZIP compression, .RAR, .7zip) and upload it.
[B]Example of directory:[/B] [I]C:/WINDOWS/.jagex_cache_32/.file_store_32/[/I]
The current cache request is: [B]317[/B] It is optional for you to support an obfusticated 317 client, or if the cache you would provide would contain a code.dat in it. It would be great if you supplied it all.
[SIZE=15pt]Information between a "Client" and a "Cache"[/SIZE] A client consists of coding: ranges from arrays, statements, declarations. Its in there in order for the client to run properly. The one [B]BIG[/B] main thing that the client needs to run off is a "CACHE".
A Cache is consisted of: Mapdata (To Load area's like Varrock, Fight Pits, Falador, Underground Area's), Music (The Songs that can be played, Also Midi Files to play like the Whip sound or burying bones sound), Images (Background, Sprites in-game [Inventory, Chat box, etc]), Models (To load Items like Abyssal Whip, Granite Maul, Fire Cape [Without these, there no point in playing a game with no items to mess with]), and Data Files.
There are a lot of cache's out there, believe me. Cache's have revision numbers that RuneScape calls them. If you are to find a cache, its most likely to be in a folder called "cache." To tell the revision number of the cache, you need to take a look at [b]main_file_cache.dat[/b]'s file size. Here's some info on current Cache Revisions:
[size=15pt]377 Cache[/size] [b]Main_file_cache.dat[/b] size ~ 18.6MB through 20MB.
[size=15pt]369 Cache[/size] [b]Main_file_cache.dat[/b] size ~ 14.8MB through 15.5MB.
[size=15pt]343 Cache[/size] [b]Main_file_cache.dat[/b] size ~ 12.7MB through 12.9MB.
[size=15pt]333 Cache[/size] [b]Main_file_cache.dat[/b] size ~ 10.9MB through 11.4MB.
[size=15pt][B]True[/B] 317 Cache[/size] [b]Main_file_cache.dat[/b] size: In my recent studies should be ranged from 4.5MB to 10MB, as of course will be a lot less in size than a 333 cache!
[size=16pt][b]What to look for in a true 317 Cache[/b][/size]
[ul][*](Possibly) Before the quest Desert Treasure was released. [*]Should be before new emotes were released (Jump for Joy, Raspberry, Spin, Shrug, Blow Kiss, Goblin Bow & Dance, Zombie Wall & Walk, Rabbit Hop) [*]Also I studied that its POSSIBLE it was before the new Prayer's were added on to (Smite, Redemption, Retribution) [*]It may be before Slayer was released, or before Farming was released. [*] [img]http://runescape.salmoneus.net/screenshots/images/19.gif[/img] [*]WAY BEFORE: Fight Pits, Obsidian Items, Fire Cape, RFD Gloves & Quest and also the correct whip emote.[/ul]
Good luck on your adventure in finding it! It may be contained in any client or just a cache by itself! Thank YOU!
[SIZE=7pt]Any kind of reward will be given out, I will also supply credentials to the provider of any cached released and posted on this post or in my inbox.[/SIZE]

item.title: Urgent Cache request - It requires your attention!
item.dc:creator: @Riedell Riedell
item.description:
@Riedell wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:13, topic:308034”][quote author=Unknown Supreme link=topic=404127.msg2994066#msg2994066 date=1255466471]
I bet I could find it if I booted up my old computer, give me a day and ill try.
[/quote]
Or he can just go here:
http://rune-archive.co.cc/[/quote]

Try and understand that Java and I are friends and that I researched and that the caches are different, they are apart from a real 317 cache.

I’ve updated the first post also, please take a look!

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Cache request - It requires your attention!
item.dc:creator: @Riedell Riedell
item.description:
@Riedell wrote:

Jordiescape:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/cache/cache.zip

Nice find again, but it looks like a 343 cache. A 333 Cache’s “Main_file_cache.dat” will be around 8mb. A 317 will be between 4.5MB through 6.5MB(Check “main_file_cache.dat”), at least lower than 8MB, like I said.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 12, 2009, 09:02:01 am[/size][hr]Its possible that it was before slayer, but I think slayer was in it too(I’ll keep adding more pictures to this post and only this post!):
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 13, 2009, 05:48:53 am[/size][hr]Updated first post, please check it.

Read full topic

item.source: Urgent Cache request - It requires your attention!

item.title: Urgent Cache request - It requires your attention!
item.dc:creator: @Riedell Riedell
item.description:
@Riedell wrote:

[quote=“r r r, post:8, topic:308034”][quote author=Riedell link=topic=404127.msg2991683#msg2991683 date=1255313151]

Yeah it has been posted somewhere.

Edit http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,370411.0.html go down a few post’s.

Very nice find but not it. Checked the file sizes and doesnt meet the criteria for a true 317 cache.
[/quote]
How do you know what the correct file size is, if you don’t have one? Also this does have old fally and some random files that aren’t needed in it.[/quote]

If you are to load the cache in to a 333 client, it will load without doing any edits. Just to like a 317 client, if you load it in to an unedited 317 client, it will not load it. Just if you were to load a 377 cache in to a 317 client, it wont work until you remove two lines of code in a 317 client for it to work. Therefore, in my precisions and my studies of a correct 317 cache, the file size should be between 4.5MB through 6.5MB(Check “main_file_cache.dat”), at least lower than 8MB. A true 317 cache will NOT have fire cape, fight pits, new emotes (Scared, Joy, Raspberry, and more), if I remember also that it may have been before Desert Treasure possibly, no pest control, old falador look and barbarian village look.

Just send me a link if you think its possible that it may be a true 317 cache, then i can test it out and research it. Yes, of course that whoever releases the cache will be private: credits will be given, and nobody else is to have it except the provider that provided it to me and just myself.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Riedell Riedell
item.description:
@Riedell wrote:

[quote=“r r r, post:4, topic:308034”][quote author=Riedell link=topic=404127.msg2991618#msg2991618 date=1255311032]

The original 317 with the old falador if I remember was released.

Thats correct, also before Fight pits were released, before more emotes came out, and even before i think if i remember desert treasure, possibly.
[/quote]
So why do you need people to find it, if it has been released?[/quote]

Actually, nobody seems to have it released. The lowest revision that I have is 194, then goes to 333. Someone must have a cache out there that’s a true 317.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Riedell Riedell
item.description:
@Riedell wrote:

If you remember playing on an old hard drive that RuneScape was played on, you need to load that hard drive up. Once you do, follow these instructions:

How to find the old cache(s)

  1. Go to Start.
  2. Click on My Computer
  3. Click on to the “C:” Drive.
  4. Click the “WINDOWS” folder.
  5. You should see a folder that is either named “.jagex_cache_32” or “.file_store_32”.
  6. Archive it (.ZIP compression, .RAR, .7zip) and upload it.

Example of directory: C:/WINDOWS/.jagex_cache_32/.file_store_32/

The current cache request is: 317
It is optional for you to support an obfusticated 317 client, or if the cache you would provide would contain a code.dat in it. It would be great if you supplied it all.

[SIZE=15pt]Information between a “Client” and a “Cache”[/SIZE]
A client consists of coding: ranges from arrays, statements, declarations. Its in there in order for the client to run properly. The one BIG main thing that the client needs to run off is a “CACHE”.

A Cache is consisted of: Mapdata (To Load area’s like Varrock, Fight Pits, Falador, Underground Area’s), Music (The Songs that can be played, Also Midi Files to play like the Whip sound or burying bones sound), Images (Background, Sprites in-game [Inventory, Chat box, etc]), Models (To load Items like Abyssal Whip, Granite Maul, Fire Cape [Without these, there no point in playing a game with no items to mess with]), and Data Files.

There are a lot of cache’s out there, believe me. Cache’s have revision numbers that RuneScape calls them. If you are to find a cache, its most likely to be in a folder called “cache.” To tell the revision number of the cache, you need to take a look at main_file_cache.dat’s file size. Here’s some info on current Cache Revisions:

[size=15pt]377 Cache[/size]
Main_file_cache.dat size ~ 18.6MB through 20MB.

[size=15pt]369 Cache[/size]
Main_file_cache.dat size ~ 14.8MB through 15.5MB.

[size=15pt]343 Cache[/size]
Main_file_cache.dat size ~ 12.7MB through 12.9MB.

[size=15pt]333 Cache[/size]
Main_file_cache.dat size ~ 10.9MB through 11.4MB.

[size=15pt]True 317 Cache[/size]
Main_file_cache.dat size: In my recent studies should be ranged from 4.5MB to 10MB, as of course will be a lot less in size than a 333 cache!

[size=16pt]What to look for in a true 317 Cache[/size]

[ul]* Before the quest Desert Treasure was released.
[]Should be before new emotes were released (Jump for Joy, Raspberry, Spin, Shrug, Blow Kiss, Goblin Bow & Dance, Zombie Wall & Walk, Rabbit Hop)
[]Also I studied that its POSSIBLE it was before the new Prayer’s were added on to (Smite, Redemption, Retribution)
[]It may be before Slayer was released, or before Farming was released.
[]
[*]WAY BEFORE: Fight Pits, Obsidian Items, Fire Cape, RFD Gloves & Quest and also the correct whip emote.[/ul]

Good luck on your adventure in finding it! It may be contained in any client or just a cache by itself! Thank YOU!

[SIZE=7pt]Any kind of reward will be given out, I will also supply credentials to the provider of any cached released and posted on this post or in my inbox.[/SIZE]
